title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L)
description: Obtain strong passes in your G.C.E. A/L. The subject stream you choose (e.g., Bio Science, Arts, Commerce) will often determine the subjects you can teach in the future.

title: Choose Your Teaching Pathway
description: Decide on your path. To teach in a government school, you typically need a degree from a state university or to enter a National College of Education (NCOE). For private/international schools, a degree and/or specific teaching diplomas are required.

title: Higher Education & Training
description: Enroll in a relevant qualification. A Bachelor of Education (B.Ed.) is ideal. Alternatively, a BA or BSc in your chosen subject followed by a Postgraduate Diploma in Education (PGDE) is a common route for government school graduate teachers.

title: Entering the Profession
description: For government schools, you must pass the competitive exam for teacher recruitment held by the Ministry of Education. For private schools, you can apply directly. Gain initial experience and apply your theoretical knowledge.
qualifications: Pass in Teacher Recruitment Competitive Exam
institutes: International Schools (e.g., CIS, British School, Lyceum, Gateway)

title: Career Progression & Senior Roles
description: With experience, teachers can progress into senior roles. In the government sector, this involves moving up service grades. In both sectors, roles like Sectional Head, Deputy Principal, and Principal are achievable. Further qualifications like a Master of Education (M.Ed.) are highly beneficial.
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and promotion
